stories.title: Geekbench 5 score for Apple M2 chip: 1919 single core, 8929 multi core
Come across a charming small biz in a sea of generic chains, ask about landlord

stories.text:
I’m sitting pretty comfy and decently paid (not faang) in a senior security position in a rather good company.

With the current market looks coupled with some upgrades I would like to do to my house and hobbies I would like to do some extra work instead of changing my currently strict budgeting.

I’ve tried to look industry work outside of “normal business” hours but I’ve come up short. Unless I want to do tier 1 help desk or SOC monitoring. Which I don’t want to do as I’ve already paid my dues in those trenches.

I’ve thought about consulting but I don’t really see a market. Typical consumers don’t care about “enterprise” grade security. I’ve thought about double dipping as I’ve seen a ton of openings in my wheelhouse. I do have some moral issues with double dipping. Currently I have full control of my schedule and it’s very lite on meetings. I could probably handle 2 9-5 jobs simultaneously. I worry about employment verifications and how my current employer could find out via background checks or credit reports.

Anyways looking for any advice from anyone who currently or formally double dipped and or finding after hours work.
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you find after hours work or double dipping
